Fields.DialogueText: Hey...
Hey. So... how did it work out?
Houston's... not sure what to think.
Oh. I'm sorry.
Quite all right. She still asked if we could hang out a little more, and get to know each other better.
Good for you!
Well, I'm not sure about it.
Why not?
I'm still not sure if she really wants to my friend, or if she's only being polite... I'm still nervous about all this.

Fields.MenuText: Look on the bright side. She agreed to get to know you better. Whether that develops into close friendship or not, your bond will grow.
You just have to keep trying, then.
You got the courage to try. That's a start, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I'll just have to see where things go.
Yes. I can't give up now.
You're right. I got this far, and I'm out in the open.
So anyway, best of luck.
Thank you. Oh!
What's wrong?
I have to get ready! Sorry, Captain, but I must be going!
Perth, wait! I still need your help. There's a Morgana fleet nearby!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So, did the time with Miss Houston go well?
It was fun.
Then why do you look a little melancholy?
It's just, she was a little... rowdy for my tastes.
Rowdy? You didn't like that?
It just seemed kind of rude. And she had some dirt on her uniform!
That's kind of to be expected. We're all going through battle after battle, after all.
Still, I'm not sure if will end up being best friends after all.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you know – differences are ok. We are both very different, yet good friends. Wouldn't you agree?
Do those flaws outweigh what you like about her, though?
It's all part of getting to know each other. I'm sure Houston learned things she didn't like about you, but the time still went well.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. A good partnership can complement each other's weaknesses, and bring of the best of each other.
No. I still want to learn more about her, even if I don't like everything.
I find it hard to believe that she would see problems in me.
Thanks. I feel a lot better now.
No problem. Let me know how the next time goes, okay?
Sure. But we have more things to worry about than our social calendars at the moment.
You're right. First and foremost, we have to keep holding the Morgana forces back.
@BATTLE
I certainly know that.
Still, you are correct. It's best to know than not to know at all, I suppose.
Then I lay down... no, that's not right! What to do...?
Something wrong?
Oh, I'm just trying to learn how to play poker, and it's a little harder than I first thought.
A game you don't know how to play? That's something new.
Well, I played a few rounds with Houston. She won every single hand! So now I'm trying to get a better grip of the play.
Looks like you're still having trouble, though.
Well, it's not the same when you're playing solitaire. I should know! Could you please play with me? Just no actual bets.
Sure – deal me in.
All right, your turn. This time, I'm going to win, no matter what!

Fields.MenuText: Funny. I never really saw you as a gambler.
Understanding a game doesn't necessarily mean that you will win all the time, you know.
What's most important in games is having fun.

Fields.DialogueText: I normally don't lower myself to such crude things, but Houston likes it, and... it's not that bad of a game.
I know that, but I want to give all I've got in each game. I won't let Houston win without a fight!
You're right. Even if this is tricky, I should be happy that Houston shared this game with me.
Hmm... I raise.
I think your biggest problem is your poker face. I can see that look of worry on your face clearly. So what's it going to be?
This!
Whoa, you won! That was a tricky poker face. I totally thought you were afraid of something.
I am! I just detected a whole bunch of Morganas.
Nuts. Time to turn in the cards and get ready for some real action.
@BATTLE
Captain, you have a minute?
We're a few minutes away from a battle, but go ahead.
Well, I was wondering if you have any suggestions for my next meeting with Houston.
What's the trouble?
I want to do something for her this time, but I'm not sure what to do. Any suggestions?

Fields.MenuText: You don't need me to choose an activity. It's what works best for you.
Maybe find something that both of you enjoy.
Just try to come up with something new.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right – in the end, it ultimately comes down to me.
Good point. It should be appealing to both of us.
Something novel? I'll see what I can do.
Thank you for the advice, Captain.
No problem. Well, actually, would you mind saving these conversations until we're out of a deadly scrape, please?
Best not to put things off before you forget about them.
Still, can we get back to business? The Morganas aren't done yet.
Don't worry, Captain! They won't last much longer.
@BATTLE
Amph, are you okay?
I'm fine. Why wouldn't I be?
You just look kind of depressed.
I said I'm fine. Okay, so I feel a little down. It's nothing.
I understand. But, if you need to talk with someone, I'm here. Or there's Houston...
I don't want to talk to her now!
So that's what's wrong. What happened?
We... had a fight. She was showing me a new game, but then she said it was something the "Caddies" or some other tribe invented.
What difference does that make?
I thought we were playing a civilized game, not some barbaric predecessor. I told her that, and she got all upset for some reason. And now, here I am.

Fields.MenuText: First of all, you should be talking to Houston. Things like this need to be sorted out between friends directly.
You need to open up and try new things.
I think that you hurt Houston's feelings, when you said that something she liked was stupid.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I can't just run and hide. We need to talk.
I know, but it's so tough to let go of my old values.
I didn't mean it like that. But... you're right. I need to apologize.
Thanks for helping me with this. Sorry that I was rough with you.
You're welcome. But I'm not the one you need to apologize to.
Good point. I'll talk to her after we deal with these Morganas.
@BATTLE
It's good to hang onto things you like, but that doesn't mean that you can't stop growing and changing.
*ALARM*
What's with that look, Perth? That melancholy does not suit you.
Oh, I am just looking at the mass of Morganas in the distance.
Yeah, it's going to be tough this time. But we'll make it through.
But for how long?
What do you mean?
Troy held off the Achaeans for a whole decade, but still fell in the end. Do we face a similar fate?
Come on, we've had our successes.
But the Morganas keep coming back. How long can we hold off in this war of attrition?

Fields.MenuText: Lighten up – sing a song, or something. Even if things look bad, we can't afford to get too gloomy.
Some of the Trojans survived, right?
Well, if we fall in the end, let's make them regret it as much as they can.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Best to keep up the spirits. We're not finished yet.
You mean the Aeneid? That was a later invention. Still, good point. As long as we stay alive, no matter where we go, our song lives on.
You're right. War is not to be envied, but if we can fight to the end with glory, we will at least shed light into the darkness of despair.
Well, it's time. Once more unto the breach?
Yes, and as many times as necessary. Charge!
@BATTLE
Hi, Perth. What's with the requisition for a "cowboy uniform"?
I ask that you approve the request promptly. It is how people dress in the Outback in Australia.
Neat. Trying to understand more about your new nation?
That, and I thought that Houston might like it.
You think so?
Cowboys are big part of her heritage, so I wanted to show that we have stuff in common.

Fields.MenuText: You'll need to actually know and care about it for Houston to believe you, though.
I'm sure she'll like it, if you like it too.
A rugged get-up would really give a new look to you.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I have been researching a lot about Perth and the surrounding areas.
Yeah - it's actually been pretty fun to learn about.
Thanks! I was a little worried about it being messy, but, being with you and Houston, it's not such a big thing to me anymore.
Anyway, it's good to see that you're getting along well with Houston.
Thanks. I really think we might be starting to bond.
The only thing that confuses me is why you focused on Australia. There are parts from your other heritage that you could share as well.
Um... we'll have to talk later! I see a few Morganas over there!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Let's try this again. Hiyah!
Perth, are you – aieeh!
Captain, your scream made me lose my concentration!
And you almost made me lose my head! Why are you throwing spears around?
I was trying out that game Houston told me about.
I see. So you decided to give it another chance?
Yep! It's actually pretty fun – sort of like shuffleboard. If only I could get these spears to throw straight!
It's okay – you're just starting to learn, after all.
I know, but I sort of envy Houston for being so athletic.

Fields.MenuText: Amph, you are already strong – without you, we wouldn't have survived to this day.
Houston taught you the game, right? That means she believes you can do it. So hang in there.
Why don't we try to learn together? I'm kind of curious myself.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. There's no game that I can't win!
Thanks. I'll keep at it.
Sure. Let me show you what I've learned so far, and we can work together from there.
I think I'm finally getting the hang of it. Here I go – wah!
Careful! You almost skewered me again.
Sorry! But we have even worse problems. My radar just picked up an enemy fleet close by.
@BATTLE
Worse than killing your Captain?!
*ALARM*
"Sing, O' Muses, of the strife at Béxar, and those noble heroes who did defy the wrath of Santa Anna..."? Good, but needs a little work.
What are you up to?
I am trying to make a poem about the Alamo.
That's neat.
I hope so. I am putting a lot of effort into the lyrics – I want something as poetic as the Iliad that sings right off the page.
How's that coming along?
Okay, I guess. The verses flow, but it's nowhere as good as Homer's works.

Fields.MenuText: Artists are hardly appreciated in their own times. I'm sure yours will be as great as Homer's one day.
Just do your best.

Fields.DialogueText: You flatter me too much. But still, thanks for the thought.
I'll do my best.
Well, time to get into the serious action scenes. The next part is where they are routed.
They're not the only ones. It's an ambush!
Don't worry, Captain. We won't give up without a fight.
@BATTLE
Perth, are you busy? I need to talk with you about the next mission!
Busy? No, just a bit confused, Captain. I just had a conversation with Houston.
Fine, Amph... What's the issue? We have work to do.
Houston overheard somebody call me "Amph" and she had no idea why. She thought they were talking about an amplifier.
Wait, she still doesn't know about your old name?
Forget I mentioned it, Captain. Let's get down to business. What do we need to do?

Fields.MenuText: We need to guard a convoy passing through the area. I need you to stay alert for trouble.
There is a large massing of Morganas up ahead. It is our duty to destroy and scatter all of them.
We need to reach a rendezvous point, even if we have to push through a blockade. You up for that?

Fields.DialogueText: I've got it. I can hear every little bit of sound at sea, so I'll know the moment they decide to make a move.
All right, then. Time to get to work.
Don't worry. A few ghost ships won't be enough to slow this ship down.
I think I just spotted the first of our opponents, Captain. I'll get ready to fight.
Okay, but I wanted to ask you, about what Houston said...
We need to focus on the battle right now. All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Captain! I'm glad you're here.
What's the prob- Oh, I see.
Any reason we're not sounding the klaxon?
I'm not sure they've noticed us, oddly enough. We might be able to get a little closer before they do if we run as quiet as we can.
I'm not opposed.
Move around the ship as quickly as you can and tell people to get to stations, though.
Will do.
@BATTLE
Good job out there, Perth.
Thanks, Captain. Now, do you need me for anything else, or can I –?
Actually, there was that one thing.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Come on, Amph. I know you're trying to avoid the subject. Doesn't she realize you are also called Amphion?
Used to be called Amphion. That's in the past, so I didn't think it was important to bring up.
But it's a key part of your life!
I know, but... I feel embarrassed about it.
What do you mean?
Well, with a Greek name and an English ancestry and an Australian allegiance, I'm not sure what I am some days. Houston, she's so determined and proud of herself. What would she think?

Fields.MenuText: You know, Houston was launched in Virginia, and Texas used to be part of Mexico, so you're not the only one with mixed heritage.
Like it or not, you need to be open about your pasts for the friendship to continue.
That simply shows how worldly you are, having so many different experiences and connections.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Maybe we're not so different after all.
You're right. I have to come clean about it.
Thanks, but I still have a lot to learn about the world. Still, good point. I don't regret my past, or where I am today.
Okay, I'll talk to Houston and explain my full story. I always appreciate your advice.
No problem. What are friends for?
*ALARM*
"I've been working on the railroad, all the live long day!"
You ought to wear a conductor's hat when you sing that one.
Thanks for the advice, Captain! I learned that Perth has a really long line of rails, so I decided to look into the topic.
So what did you think?
It's pretty neat. I never realized that there were so many ways of linking things across the land. And the songs are pretty cool, in their own way.
I could tell, from the cheer in your voice.
You could? That's good to know. But I wonder if I should try to invent my own lyrical tune.

Fields.MenuText: Go for it.
Just let me hear it when you're done with it, please.
I'm sure it will be great.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll get started right away.
Sure! You'll love what I have in store.
Thanks. I'll do my best.
Now, the toughest part of a song is the beginning. What to say...? Choo choo? Steam?
Man the guns.
Man the guns? That has a nice ring to it, but I am not quite sure if that is appropriate in the context.
It is for ours. Look up ahead.
Ah, I see. Time to lock on and fire.
@BATTLE
Perth! Perth! We have a problem!
I'm here, Captain! What's wrong?
"What's wrong?" Look at all the rabbits running loose on the deck!
You're right, this is awful!
I know. So get –
These poor dears need food and water. Might you help me with that?
Sure... Wait! No, no. That's not the issue! The issue is why there is a colony of rabbits on board to begin with.
Oh, I caught a few on shore leave and decided to take them with us. They sure multiply, huh?
Perth, whatever made you think that this was a good idea?
Well, it was custom back in the commons at Portsmouth that if you could catch one, you got to keep it.
That doesn't mean you can just bring them here!
Why not? Their fur is quite useful, and they are quite friendly, aren't they?
Perth...
Come on, who can resist their cute, adorable faces?
If the rabbits get too troublesome, they might interfere with your social life.
Rabbits like that have become a big menace in Australia, you know.
It's going to be hard feeding all of them.
What would Houston say?
Oh, Houston already knows about it. In fact, she was the one who suggested it after I mentioned the practice.
Good point. I don't want to get in hot water with my new nation.
Well?
Okay, we can sell most of the lot. But could I keep just a couple, please?
Sure, just as long as they can't breed together. But they will be your responsibility, understand?
I know, Captain. I won't let you down.
Good. Now stow those rabbits somewhere out of the way. We can't have them mucking about, not when there are Morgana ships on our tail.
@BATTLE
I should have known... This won't go over well with HQ.
*ALARM*
Hmph! What does she know, really?
What's wrong now?
Oh, Houston was saying that I'm not plainspoken enough, that it's tough to understand what I say. She learns dozens of strange tongues, and she can't understand a little poetry?
Don't get so worked up over it.
I know, but it's still an insult to my pride and heritage.

Fields.MenuText: Did she say that she disliked your songs, or just how you talk to her regularly?
Well, you did hide some secrets from her before.
It's important for people to understand each other, though.

Fields.DialogueText: No, she didn't mention my songs – other than asking me to sing something.
Good point. I guess she just wants me to be a little upfront about things.
Yes, it is... Maybe I can try to be a little clearer.
I'll see what I can do, but I won't make promises. It's a part of who I am.
That's okay – it's the thought that counts. Still, you should be telling that to Houston, not me.
Right! I'll do that – after we get rid of these interlopers.
@BATTLE
See? She still likes a lot of things about you.
*ALARM*
Ugh, come on! Why are you being so difficult?
What's wrong, Perth?
I was trying to make a barbeque dish, and things aren't working out right.
I can see that. Here's a towel to wipe that sauce off you.
Thanks. This is proving harder than I anticipated.
More than you think. The grill's on fire.
Bloody hell! How cowboys can enjoy such gritty fare is beyond me.
So you're making this for Houston?
Partially, but this is also popular in Australia. I really want to show that I can do a good job with this. What should I do?

Fields.MenuText: Take a deep breath. Don't panic. You won't get anywhere if you let your fears run wild.
You can always ask Houston for advice, you know.
What's most important is that you genuinely believe and wish for your food to be delicious.

Fields.DialogueText: Right. I can do this.
Good idea. She might have some tips.
Really? I guess I was kind of skeptical about the style of food to begin with. I have to really put my heart into it.
Thanks for the help.
No worries. Mind if you leave me a small piece when you get done, please?
Sure. But right now, we'll have to set aside the cooking. It's time to roast some Morganas.
Let's get on it – but remember to put on that fire!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Is it just the one?
I sense there's more. When was the last time you encountered a lone Morgana?
Fingers crossed, then.
@BATTLE
At least we know this area of the waters will be safe for a while.
Hopefully. You never know for sure.
Yeah. Still... Captain, do you think I could have a little bit of leave, please?
Reason?
Well, I was thinking on having a little adventure with Houston.
What sort of adventure?
Who knows? That's the beauty of it. But I think that it would be a lot of fun. So can I? Please?

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful and don't get into any frays with Morganas; the two of you make a strong team, but you don't want to get swamped.
Sure, but...do you think I could tag along? I think it would be kind of exciting.
Don't stray too far. We'll need both of you if trouble comes.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. We'll be careful.
Huh? Of course you can. The more the merrier!
Don't worry. Just give us a whistle and we'll come charging back. We can't go that far, anyways.
Who knows what we will find out?
Just as long as it's not more Morganas.
You look happy.
I sure am. Houston and I had a ball today!
That's good to hear. So you're getting along well with her, then?
Yes. I really have to thank you for encouraging me to befriend her.
I just helped you think things through. It ultimately came down to you.
You're right. At first, I was really awed and fearful of her, but I've realized that we have a whole lot in common.
Like what?
Well, we have both traveled around the world, we are both determined in combat, we both feel alone...
What was that last part?
Oh, nothing! Forget I said anything.
Amph, please.
Well, I've kind of realized that we are both loners in our own way. Houston is so fierce and brave in battle, but she's used to doing things her own way, alone.
And me... well, it turns out that Perth might be a fitting name for me. It's such an isolated city. And I have a lot of trouble connecting with other people.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, you're not lonely anymore, right?
It can get kind of lonely at sea, can't it? I think we all feel that way, somehow.
That just makes the bonds you have made even more important. So hold onto them close, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: (smiles) No, I'm not.
Yeah. It's a good thing we all have each other to rely on.
I will. We all will.
Well, I hope things between you two keep going well.
Thanks. I feel stronger than ever, with my friends beside me.
That's good, because we're going to need that power in a minute! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Another day, another fight, eh, Perth?
That seems to be the case, all right.
Hopefully we'll get some time to rest at some point. The whole world needs a vacation right now.
Hey, that makes me wonder...
Is it a question relevant to the battle? Well, I guess it doesn't matter. What is it?
I'm just wondering where the next World's Fair will be.
I'm not sure if there will be one for a while. Nowhere seems to be safe these days.
But it's such an important event. Hopefully we can all attend it.

Fields.MenuText: I wonder how they would accommodate Belles for the convention.
What new exhibits do you think they will have?
Where would you like them to have the next one?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure that they will find a way.
Probably something with us Belles. We have a lot to share with the world.
Hmmm... Africa.
Well, anyway, we need to end this war first. Let's do our best to end it in time for the next celebration!
You've got it! Time for some fireworks!
@BATTLE
Really?
Well, it's out of the way, so it might be safer from the Morganas. And... it would be something new.
You really have grown, haven't you, Amph?
*ALARM*
Hey, Captain? Could I ask you some advice, please?
Ask away.
I was thinking of watching a movie with Houston. But I'm not sure what we should watch.
And you want me to decide?
Well, make a suggestion at least.
Amph, I'm not an expert at this sort of thing.
Still, your opinion would be welcome.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe some sort of American Western film?
A Bing Crosby movie?
How about something that neither of you have seen before?

Fields.DialogueText: That would be interesting. I have wanted to figure out what makes that kind of action appealing.
Yes. I am sure she will love the comedy.
That's... not a bad idea. It could make the experience novel for the both of us. I'll see what I can come up with.
Thanks for the suggestion, Captain. It's always good to get a second or third opinion.
Thanks. Now maybe you can answer something for me.
Oh?
Is it a coincidence with this sort of timing, or do you forget to keep watch during conversations like this?
Oops.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hmm...
What's that you're trying to eat, Perth?
Some recipes from the Philippines or something. Houston likes them, apparently.
And what about you?
Well, she'd made them, so it wasn't like I could refuse.

Fields.MenuText: But you still tried it, though. You're a good friend.
You didn't answer me. Do you like it?
If you don't want it, I'm more than happy to have it myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks... It's not bad, I guess.
I suppose so... It has an interesting way of blending different styles of flavor together.
No! I... I mean, I already bit into it.
Well, it smells delicious.
Yes, I shall have to ask her for the recipe. Now for the last bites...
*BOOM*
No, my food!
Looks like Morganas are causing some waves.
Not for long, they won't!
@BATTLE
Oh, no problem.
Lots of birds in flight today.
They certainly are a wonderful sight. I must compose a poem for this occasion!
Knock yourself out. I wonder if they are migrating.
Migrating?
Yes. A lot of birds fly to different locations depending on the time of year. For instance, a bird in France might also nest somewhere in Africa in a different part of the year.
Really? That is kind of odd. So a bird from England – or Greece – might become Australian?
I suppose so.
Hmm...

Fields.MenuText: Of course, the opposite also holds true. When the seasons change again, the birds return to their original homes.
It's amazing how they can travel so far across the world, isn't it?
Say, can you predict the future with birds?

Fields.DialogueText: I see. That bears remembering.
Yes, it is. I guess that distance is not an excuse for avoiding new things.
You mean augury? I'm sorry, but my experience with Greece doesn't cover that field.
There they go.
It looks like they are scattering for some reason.
I can see why. Everyone, into formation!
@BATTLE
Ugh! Stupid... things! Why did you people not have the decency to make a sensible alphabet?
Something bothering you?
Oh, I'm just trying to learn this accursed tongue.
"How to Read and Write Mandarin..." You're practicing Chinese?
Trying is the word for it. Houston said this was the easiest of the books when she loaned me it, and it's still giving me a headache!

Fields.MenuText: Then why did you borrow it?
Well, it's a two-way exchange. After you learn this, perhaps you can teach Houston Greek.
Just keep at it. Think of it as mastering a new art.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, she seemed so interested in it that I wanted to see what it was all about.
You're right. Maybe we should do a study session together.
That's an interesting perspective. I have to admit, there is a bit of an artistic touch to these picture-symbol thingies. I'll do my best.
So, have you made any progress yet?
Shi – that means yes.
That's good. It's great to learn new things, even if they're challenging.
Shi... it is.
Glad to see that you're opening up more with your new friend.
It's not just Houston who is helping – it's you, and all of my friends. Thank you.
You're welcome. Better set that book aside for now, though. The Morganas don't care what language you speak – they just sink everyone.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Sigh...
Amph, what's wrong?
Nothing.
Are you sure? Did your time with Houston hit another snag? You just have to work out your differences...
No, we're getting along really well. But, I'm not sure if I should keep going with everything.
Why, if everything is going so well?
That's the problem – I care for her friendship too much. We're at war out here, and every day brings a new risk. One day, we might take one too many risks, and be separated, forever.

Fields.MenuText: Even if you distance yourself, you might not be able to let go of your bond that easily.
But it's when you're together with friends that you're the strongest. As long as you stick together, you can keep each other from falling.
But if you turn away from everyone, you'll still be lonely.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I... couldn't forget the times we've shared together.
Yes! Together, nothing can stop us. I just have to keep working hard, so we can all succeed in our dreams!
It's tough being alone. I don't want to go back to that sort of isolation.
Are you feeling better now?
Yes. And thank you, Captain.
You've given me the courage to take a new gamble.
Huh?
I'll explain later. Right now, we have another Morgana at hand. We've come so far, I don't want this to end now!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I've got it!
Got what? Oh, no, not again!
Don't worry, Captain. I've gotten better with throwing the boomerang, see?
You're right. I'm not unconscious. It didn't even come close to my head this time! You've been practicing?
Yes. Now I can start training with Houston for the act.
Act?
Yes. We're thinking of doing a sort of rodeo performance with a lot of different tricks.
So that's your "gamble" you mentioned. That sounds great! You're really putting a lot of effort into this, huh?
I sure am. This is going to be really interesting.
I have to say, you have really changed since we first met.
Thanks, although I'm always a little uneasy about changing too much.

Fields.MenuText: Houston has changed, too. I have changed. We all learn new things as we travel and interact.
You're just maturing, and that's perfectly natural.
Just because you change doesn't mean you lose who you are. All your memories are still somewhere in your heart.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Let's all find our new futures together.
Yeah, I have learned a lot about the world and myself, and I don't regret it.
Yes, all my experiences, good and bad, have made me who I am today.
When you get around to the show, be sure to give me a ticket, please.
Of course- a front row ticket in fact. We still have to practice more.
Right now, it's time for some target practice, if you catch my drift.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
A little more polish, and it'll be ready...
What's up, Amph?
Oh, nothing!
You sure?
Actually, I'd like your advice on this. What do you think?
That's a beautiful boomerang! Where did you get it?
Quite nice, eh? I called in a favor and had it sent from Perth. A bit too fancy to throw, but quite a nice decorative item.
Seems expensive.
It was, but... I hope it will be appreciated enough to justify the expense.
So that boomerang is a gift, then?
That's right... and a well-earned one, too.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure Miss Houston will treasure it!
There's nothing quite like treating yourself to something nice.
For me? You shouldn't have...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh...
Interesting advice... but no, this boomerang is not a gift to myself.
Were you kidding or did you actually guess?
The truth is, I got this for you, Captain.
I've been trying so hard to impress Houston, to have somebody I respect and admire as a friend. I'll admit, I got distracted.
@BATTLE
What?
Relax. I was only kidding, Perth.
Distracted from what?
From somebody who's been a peerless companion to me through everything. I got you this boomerang to express my gratitude for your friendship. Hope you like it.
I don't know what to say except thank you. And to get to battle stations.
Ah! Morganas trying to ruin our moment? I can't possibly lose when I'm fighting alongside a treasured friend.
I couldn't agree more.
Just don't throw that boomerang at the Morganas! It belongs somewhere nice in your cabin!
*ALARM*
